org.apache.oodt.commons.activity

Class DatagramLoggingActivityFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.oodt.commons.activity.DatagramLoggingActivityFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActivityFactory

    public class DatagramLoggingActivityFactory
extends Object
implements ActivityFactory
    This activity factory produces activities that log their incidents using datagrams. It examines the system properties to determine where to send the incidents. The property org.apache.oodt.commons.activity.DatagramLoggingActivityFactory.host (or activity.host if not defined) teslls to what host to send the datagrams. There's no default value, and it's an runtime exception if neither property's defined.

    The property org.apache.oodt.commons.activity.DatagramLoggingActivityFactory.port (or activity.port if not defined) tells to what port to send the datagrams. It defaults to 4556.

    Once created, it records incidents by serializing them into a byte buffer and sending that buffer as a datagram to the activity host/port. This does limit the size of incidents that can go over, but most incidents are pretty small.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    Kelly
